results.title: Too dirty for a woman
results.creator_credit: Diane Beaudry, Kathleen Shannon, Signe Johansson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In Labrador City, Newfoundland, women have been hired by the Iron Ore Company as truck drivers, engineers, laborers, geologists, warehouse workers, machinists, and mechanics. Living in a company town, they are pioneers in their own community. The women talk about their non-traditional jobs, their new feelings of independence, and how their families’ lives have been affected. One of the consequences is that husbands now share household chores. There are, however, obstacles to be overcome before women can apply for a job, such as the scarcity of day care facilities and a lack of public transportation. Strong visuals show women at work driving a 130-tonne truck, surveying a blast pattern for a drill, or acting as the first female foreman, alias foreperson.

results.title: There are yachts at the bottom of my garden
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Many people believe that eighteen footers are the most exciting boats racing on Sydney Harbour. They certainly attract more spectators than any other class of boat. This film talks about sailing on Sydney Harbour. By contrast with those who live in one of the world’s capitals, such as London, and who may have to drive some distance to reach their boats, the average Sydney sailor is lucky: there are literally yachts at the bottom of the garden.

results.title: Theobald faces the facts
results.creator_credit: Cal Dunn, Joe Betzer and Cal Dunn Studios
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon which presents facts that reveal the inaccuracy of mythical fancies concerning the effects of alcoholic beverages. The film technique used is designed for audience participation.

results.title: There's a hippopotamus on our roof eating cake
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Hazel Edwards wrote the award winning “Hippo” book with the help of her children. Featuring Deborah Niland’s colourful and lively illustrations, the story has won world wide acclaim and has been translated into many languages including Japanese and Braille. The story centres around the lovable and lively “Hippo”, who can do anything especially the things you are not allowed to do!

results.title: Thelma and Louise [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, Mimi Polk and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Fasten your seatbelts as two of Hollywood’s hottest women rev it up and take it on the road. When unhappy housewife Thelma (Geena Davis) and her wisecracking friend Louise (Susan Sarandon) decide to take a break from their lives, they embark on a trip that leads to a tragic incident at a roadside honky tonk. In an instant, their weekend “getaway” becomes just that as they flee across the American southwest with the police one step behind. A classic twist on the usual “buddy-outlaw” movie, where men are most often the unlikely heroes, this film has a charming, refreshing and triumphant outlook. Cast also includes Harvey Keitel.

results.title: Their first year
results.creator_credit: Roland Feven, Phillip Sattin and Eothen Films
results.brief_description: Advice for mothers on child care during the first year of life. Observes several mothers and babies and gives guidance on such subjects as bathing, breast and bottle feeding, teething, potting, sickness after meals, the “three month colic”, immunization, and hazards in the home. Raises, without trying to resolve, the problem of the psychological impact of a new arrival on older children.

results.title: Zoo baby animals
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Opportunity for children to look behind the scenes at the zoo - to see activities in the kitchen and hospital; how baby animals are fed and cared for by their keepers. Shows many animals in attractive outdoor settings and in “children’s zoo” sections in the famous Lincoln Park and Brookfield Zoos of Chicago. Baby animals featured in the film are the lion, tiger, gorilla, bear, elephant, harbor seal, kudu, llama, Barbary sheep, tapir and baboon.

results.title: Zoo
results.creator_credit: Gerry Hudson, David Hughes, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: This film was made at the Melbourne Zoo and, without commentary, shows the activities - particularly eating - of birds in the air and animals on land and in water. There are some interesting close-ups of parts of animals, eg. the texture of the skin of a hippo and the back of an eagle.

results.title: The Track
results.creator_credit: Michael Cordell, Nick Greenaway, Victoria Pitt, Penny Chapman, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Chapman Pictures and Hilton Cordell Productions
results.brief_description: A 6 part series on the history of the Australian Racing Industry from the different points of view of the jockeys, trainers, bookies, callers, punters and politicians. Horse racing started in the 1700’s to give the developing colony something social and sporting to go to, and was a popular pastime, despite the ban on swearing, fighting, gambling and drinking, and has since developed into a huge industry. Each episode covers a period of time in racing history from 1788 to current racing, and includes interviews with trainers, jockeys and callers of the past. Footage of famous horses includes Phar Lap and Bernborough. Narrated by Tiriel Mora.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Cordell, Nick Greenaway, Victoria Pitt, Penny Chapman, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Chapman Pictures and Hilton Cordell Productions
